voip_qoe_src job¶

Method listing¶

Sources of the voip_qoe_src.py file

voip_qoe_src.files.voip_qoe_src.build_parser()¶

Method used to validate the parameters supplied to the program

Returns:an object containing required/optional arguments with their values
Return type:object
voip_qoe_src.files.voip_qoe_src.get_timestamp()¶

To get a simple timestamp

Returns:the current time in milliseconds
Return type:int
voip_qoe_src.files.voip_qoe_src.main(config, args)¶

Main method

Parameters:
  • config (dict) – a dict object that contain the parameters of the ‘internal_config.yml’ file
  • args (object) – the parsed arguments returned by the parser
Returns:

nothing
class voip_qoe_src.files.codec.CodecConstants(collect_agent, etc_dir_path, codec_name)¶

A CodecConstants object contains default and specific constants as defined by the ITU-T All values are set as class attributes to be easily accessed later

load_default_constants(collect_agent, etc_dir_path)¶

Method to load default constants common to all codecs See https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-G.107-201506-I for default constants

Parameters:
  • collect_agent (object) – the OpenBACH collect agent
  • etc_dir_path (str) – the path of the ‘etc’ config directory
Returns:

nothing
load_specific_constants(collect_agent, etc_dir_path, codec_name)¶

See https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-G.113-200711-I for codec-specific values

Parameters:
  • collect_agent (object) – the OpenBACH collect agent
  • etc_dir_path (str) – the path to the etc directory that contains configuration files
  • codec_name (str) – one of the supported codecs (G.711.1, G.711.2, G.723.1, G.729.2, G.729.3)
Returns:

nothing

Sources of the compute_mos.py file

voip_qoe_src.files.compute_mos.compute_id(c, T, Ta, No, Ro, Ist)¶

Id corresponds to an estimation for the impairments due to the talker echo

See ITU-T G.107 recommendation (06/2015) https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-G.107-201506-I

Parameters:
  • c (CodecConstants) – the codec object with default and specific values
  • T (float) – the mean one-way delay of the echo path (ms)
  • No (float) – the power addition of different noise sources
  • Ro (float) – the basic signal-to-noise ratio
  • Ist (float) – the impairment caused by non-optimum sidetone
Returns:

an estimation for the impairments due to the talker echo Id
Return type:

float
voip_qoe_src.files.compute_mos.compute_ie_eff(Ie, Ppl, Bpl, BurstR)¶

Ie-eff corresponds to the effective equipment impairment factor

See ITU-T G.107 recommendation (06/2015) https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-G.107-201506-I/fr

Parameters:
  • Ie (float) – the equipment impairment factor (depends on the codec used)
  • Ppl (float) – the packet-loss probability
  • Bpl (float) – the packet-loss robustness factor
  • BurstR (float) – the so-called burst ratio
Returns:

the effective equipment impairment factor Ie-eff
Return type:

float
voip_qoe_src.files.compute_mos.compute_is(c, Ro, Xolr, Ist)¶

Is corresponds to the sum of all impairments which may occur more or less simultaneously with the voice transmission

See ITU-T G.107 recommendation (06/2015) https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-G.107-201506-I

Parameters:
  • c (CodecConstants) – the codec object with default and specific values
  • Ro (float) – the basic signal-to-noise ratio
  • Xolr (float) – Xolr
  • Ist (float) – the impairment caused by non-optimum sidetone
Returns:

the sum of all impairments Is
Return type:

float
voip_qoe_src.files.compute_mos.compute_mos_value(r_value)¶

Method to convert a R-factor value into a MOS value

Parameters:r_value (float) – a float between 0 and 120 (R-factor)
Returns:the Mean Opinion Score (MOS), i.e., a float between 0 and 5
Return type:float
voip_qoe_src.files.compute_mos.compute_r_value(c: voip_qoe_src.files.codec.CodecConstants, T, Ta, Ppl, jitter, use_jitter=True)¶

Method to compute the transmission rating factor R

See ITU-T G.107 recommendation (06/2015) https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-G.107-201506-I

Parameters:
  • c (CodecConstants) – the codec object with default and specific values
  • T (float) – the mean one-way delay of the echo path (ms)
  • Ta (float) – the absolute delay (ms)
  • Ppl (float) – the random packet-loss probability
  • jitter (float) – the average jitter measured
  • use_jitter (bool) – whether or not the MOS computation should take the jitter into account
Returns:

the transmission rating factor R-value
Return type:

float
voip_qoe_src.files.compute_mos.compute_ro(c, No)¶

Ro corresponds to the basic signal-to-noise ratio

See ITU-T G.107 recommendation (06/2015) https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-G.107-201506-I

Parameters:
  • c (CodecConstants) – the codec object with default and specific values
  • No (float) – the power addition of different noise sources
Returns:

the basic signal-to-noise ratio Ro
Return type:

float
voip_qoe_src.files.compute_mos.estimate_user_satisfaction(mos_value)¶

Method that returns a textual user satisfaction from a MOS value

Parameters:mos_value (float) – a float between 0 and 5 (MOS)
Returns:a user satisfaction
Return type:str
